updateElements.mainContentHeader: Your device will restart during this update
updateElements.subHeader: Kindly scroll down to view the complete steps and description
updateElements.mainContentText:
Security is of paramount importance in the Briteland, and with this in mind, Britetech have identified this Mac as not yet updated to the current and correct version of the macOS operating system.

This Mac must be updated to the current version to ensure that our IT infrastructure and security protocols are adhered to.
Updating should take no more than 10 or 15 minutes (likely less) and will not affect any of your data or settings in any way.

You may defer the update of macOS on this device, but 36 hours after this notification, an update will be enforced by Britetech, and your device will update itself and restart.

An alternate option is to defer the update, and then at the end of your business day, or during your lunch period, you can update manually, which only takes a few clicks (see below):

1. Save all your work, and close all open windows.
2. Navigate to System Settings (via the Finder window or by clicking the Apple icon at the top left of your screen).
3. In System Settings, navigate to General > Software Update and click on ‘Update Now’, and your device will update itself to the latest version (including a restart).

Thank you for your time and help in ensuring that the Britespace remains at its most secure.
updateElements.mainContentNote: Important Notes: please save all your work before starting the update
updateElements.mainContentSubHeader: Updates can take around 15 minutes to complete
updateElements.oneDayDeferralButtonText: Tomorrow, even if Okta and Slack is blocked
